Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: trivy
Description: A simple and comprehensive vulnerability scanner

Arguments.Name: --quiet
Arguments.Description: Suppress progress bar and log output [$TRIVY_QUIET]

Arguments.Name: --severity
Arguments.Description: Severities of vulnerabilities to be displayed (comma separated) (default: "UNKNOWN,LOW,MEDIUM,HIGH,CRITICAL") [$TRIVY_SEVERITY]

Arguments.Name: --exit-code
Arguments.Description: Exit code when vulnerabilities were found (default: 0) [$TRIVY_EXIT_CODE]

Arguments.Name: --security-checks
Arguments.Description: Comma-separated list of what security issues to detect (vuln,config) (default: "vuln") [$TRIVY_SECURITY_CHECKS]

Arguments.Name: --ignore-policy
Arguments.Description: Specify the Rego file to evaluate each vulnerability [$TRIVY_IGNORE_POLICY]

Arguments.Name: --list-all-pkgs
Arguments.Description: Enabling the option will output all packages regardless of vulnerability (default: false) [$TRIVY_LIST_ALL_PKGS]

Arguments.Name: --offline-scan
Arguments.Description: Do not issue API requests to identify dependencies [$TRIVY_OFFLINE_SCAN]

Arguments.Name: --skip-files
Arguments.Description: Specify the file paths to skip traversal [$TRIVY_SKIP_FILES]

Arguments.Name: --skip-dirs
Arguments.Description: Allow insecure server connections when using SSL [$TRIVY_INSECURE]

Arguments.Name: --removed-pkgs
Arguments.Description: Detect vulnerabilities of removed packages (default: false) [$TRIVY_REMOVED_PKGS]

Arguments.Name: --input
Arguments.Description: Input file path instead of image name [$TRIVY_INPUT]

Arguments.Name: --download-db-only
Arguments.Description: Download/update vulnerability database but don't run a scan [$TRIVY_DOWNLOAD_DB_ONLY]

Arguments.Name: --insecure
Arguments.Description: Allow insecure server connections when using SSL [$TRIVY_INSECURE]

Arguments.Name: filesystem
Arguments.Description: Scan local filesystem for language-specific dependencies and config files
